name: Labadi Beach (La Pleasure Beach)
address: Labadi, Accra (Near La Palm Royal Beach Hotel)
description: One of Accra’s most popular beaches, known for its lively atmosphere, horseback riding, beach bars, and live music on weekends. Great for swimming and relaxing.

name: Skybar 25 (Rooftop Bar)
address: African Regent Hotel, 237-238 Airport West, Accra
cost: Cocktails from ₵80–₵150, entry sometimes free (VIP sections may charge)
description: A luxurious rooftop bar with panoramic views of Accra, perfect for sunset cocktails, live DJs, and a classy night out.

name: Jamestown (Historic District & Lighthouse)
description: A historic fishing community with colonial-era buildings, street art, and the iconic Jamestown Lighthouse (great for photos).

name: Oxford Street, Osu (Shopping & Nightlife Hub)
address: Osu, Accra (Stretches from Koala to Burger & Relish)
description: The heart of Accra’s entertainment, packed with restaurants (like Buka), bars, clubs, and fashion boutiques.

name: Kwame Nkrumah Mausoleum
description: A memorial park dedicated to Ghana’s first president, featuring a museum, statues, and beautiful gardens.

name: Bojo Beach (Private Beach Resort)
address: Near Densu Delta, Weija (30 mins from Accra)
description: A clean, private beach with white sand, palm trees, and a relaxed vibe—great for families and picnics.

name: Republic Bar & Grill (Live Music & Drinks)
address: Osu, Accra (Behind Papaye, near Oxford St.)
description: A trendy bar with Afrobeat music, creative cocktails, and a vibrant crowd—especially lively on weekends.

name: Aburi Botanical Gardens
address: Aburi, Eastern Region (1-hour drive from Accra)
description: A serene mountain garden with exotic plants, picnic spots, and cool breezes—perfect for nature lovers.

name: The Arts Centre (Crafts Market)
address: 28th February Rd, Accra (Near Kwame Nkrumah Circle)
description: The best place to buy Ghanaian crafts, kente cloth, beads, and wood carvings at negotiable prices.

name: Achimota Forest Reserve
description: A peaceful forest reserve with walking trails, birdwatching, and a break from city noise.

name: Kokrobite Beach (Drumming & Reggae Vibes)
description: Home to Big Milly’s Shack, a famous spot for drumming, bonfires, and reggae music on weekends.
